subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] From a VERY new enthusiast....
msgSnippet: I m still making my way (chapter 10 of 12) of the excellent tutorial (progressive reader) Alice in Wonderland. This is a really useful and worthwhile work in
messageBody:
I'm still making my way (chapter 10 of 12) of the
excellent tutorial (progressive reader) Alice in
Wonderland.
This is a really useful and worthwhile work in
itself, but I have to admit I agree with you about the
Australian accent.
The fact that the author decided to drop his Rs as
in his speech only makes it more difficult for this
poor American speaker.

--- Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
> hard it would be to communicate. It is hard enough
> reading Huck Finn,
> but then consider that you had to read a complicated
> article written in
> the same manner, and on top of that, written in
> Australian dialect,
> which for us Americans is very difficult to
> understand. It might take


===========
Never insult anyone by accident.
- Robert A. Heinlein
